com.cogentex.real.api
Class RealProMgr

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.cogentex.real.api.RealProMgr
public class RealProMgr
extends java.lang.Object

The RealProMgr class implements a RealPro Manager used for realizing surface sentences from sentential syntactic specifications using Deep-Syntactic Structures (DSyntSs) implemented with objects of type org.w3c.dom.Element.

The RealPro Manager can realize individual DSyntS, or can realize in batch all the DSyntSs contained in a document implemented with org.w3c.dom.Document. When a single DSyntS is realized, the resulting realized sentence is returned in a org.w3c.dom.DocumentFragment. When all the DSyntSs contained in a document are realized in batch, the same document is returned where each DSyntS has been replaced with a org.w3c.dom.DocumentFragment containing the corresponding realized sentence.

The RealPro Manager is provided with a built-in linguistic knowledge bases for English realization, which makes it usable without requiring any configuration.

Here is the an example illustrating the realization of individual DSyntSs using the RealPro Manager built-in configuration:

Realization of individual DSyntSs: 

      //Initialization of the RealPro Manager
      RealProMgr  realproManager  = new RealProMgr();

      //Creation of a first DSyntS
      org.w3c.dom.Element  dsynts1  = ...

      //Realization of the first DSyntS
      org.w3c.dom.Fragment  result1  = realproManager.realize(dsynts1);

      //Processing of the first realized sentence
      //...

      //Creation of a first DSyntS
      org.w3c.dom.Element  dsynts2  = ...

      //Realization of the first DSyntS
      org.w3c.dom.Fragment  result2  = realproManager.realize(dsynts2);

      //Processing of the second realized sentence
      //...
Here is the an example illustrating the realization in batch of all the DSyntSs contained in a document, using the RealPro Manager built-in configuration:

Batch realization of DSyntSs contained in a document: 

      //Initialization of the RealPro Manager
      RealProMgr  realproManager  = new RealProMgr();

      //Creation of a document containing DSyntSs
      org.w3c.dom.Document  document = ...

      //Realization in batch of all the DSyntSs containined in the document
      realproManager.realize(document);

      //Processing of the document containing the realized sentences
      //...
The creation of an instance of RealPro Manager can require a delay of few seconds because of the time necessary to initialize the data structures used for the realization knowledge bases. Therefore, in general, for a given application, it is recommended to create only one instance of RealPro Manager, and to create it during the initialization of the application when the delay has less impact.

Here is the an example of an application using the RealPro Manager to realize in batch all DSyntSs contained in a document loaded from a file:

Realization application sample: 

      //RealPro Manager implementation
      import com.cogentex.real.api.RealProMgr;

      //Document representation for loaded XML file
      import org.w3c.dom.Document;

      public class MyApplication
      {
          RealProMgr  realproManager  = null;

          public static void main(String args[])
          {
              if (args.length == 0)
              {
                  System.out.println("Usage: java ... MyApplication  XML-FileName");
                  return;
              }
              MyApplication app = new MyApplication();
              app.run(args[0]);
          }

          public MyApplication()
          {
              //One time initialization of the RealPro Manager with built-in configuration
              realproManager  = new RealProMgr();
          }

          public void run( String XML_FileName )
          {
              try
              {
                System.out.println("Loading: " + XML_FileName);
                Document document = realproManager.loadXMLFile(XML_FileName);

                System.out.println("Printing loaded document:\n");
                System.out.println( realproManager.toXMLString(document, true, "  ") );

                System.out.println("Realizing DSyntSs in document...\n");
                realproManager.realize(document);

                System.out.println("Printing loaded document with realized DSyntSs:\n");
                System.out.println( realproManager.toXMLString(document, true, "  ") );
              }
              catch ( Exception e )
              {
                System.out.println(e);
              }
          }
      }
Initial document before realization: 
      <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
      <HTML version="-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
      <BODY>
      <H2>Sentence Specification</H2>

         <dsynts>
            <dsyntnode class="verb" lexeme="love" rel="nil">
               <dsyntnode class="proper_noun" lexeme="John" rel="I"></dsyntnode>
                   <B>
                      <dsyntnode class="proper_noun" lexeme="Mary" rel="II"></dsyntnode>
                   </B>
            </dsyntnode>
         </dsynts>

      </BODY>
      </HTML>
Resulting document after realization: 
     <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
     <HTML version="-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
     <BODY>
     <H2>Sentence Specification</H2>

     John loves <B>Mary</B>.

     </BODY>
     </HTML>

Method Detail

isInitialized

public boolean isInitialized()
Verifies whether the class has been initialized correctly.

realize

public org.w3c.dom.Document realize(org.w3c.dom.Document document)
Realizes all the deep-syntactic structures (DSyntSs) contained in a document received in parameter (document). Returns the document with realized surface sentences replacing the deep-syntactic structures (DSyntSs).

A deep-syntactic structure is kept in the resulting document if its realization has failed. Realization error messages can be obtained using the method RealProMgr#getErrorMsgs.

realize

public org.w3c.dom.DocumentFragment realize(org.w3c.dom.Element dsynts)
Realizes a deep-syntactic structure (DSyntS) received in parameter (dsynts). Returns the resulting sentence contained in a document fragment of type org.w3c.dom.DocumentFragment.

If the realization is successful, the returned object contains the resulting sentence structure where embedded texts and tags are represented respectively using the classes org.w3c.dom.Text and org.w3c.dom.Element.

If the realization has failed, the returned document fragment contains no sentence structure. A realization error message can be obtained using the method RealProMgr#getErrorMsg.

realize

public java.lang.String realize(com.cogentex.ti.data.Element dsynts)
Realizes a deep-syntactic structure (DSyntS) received in parameter (dsynts). Returns the resulting sentence as a string.

If the realization has failed, the returned sentence is null. A realization error message can be obtained using the method RealProMgr#getErrorMsg.

loadUserLexicon

public boolean loadUserLexicon(java.lang.String filename)
Loads user-defined lexical entries from a lexicon file specified by filename. More than one lexicon file can be loaded and user-defined lexical entries have precedence on the built-in lexical entries during realization. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the loading is successful or not.

See RealProMgr#clearUserLexicon to clear the user-defined lexical entries.

clearUserLexicons

public void clearUserLexicons()
Clears all user-defined lexical entries currently loaded.

See RealProMgr#loadUserLexicon to load user-defined lexical entries from a file.

toDSSString

loadDSSFile

public org.w3c.dom.Document loadDSSFile(java.lang.String filename)
Loads a deep-syntactic structure (DSyntS) defined in a file filename received in parameter formatted using RealPro DSS file format. Returns a document containing the DSyntS. The document is null if the loading has failed.

loadXMLFile

public org.w3c.dom.Document loadXMLFile(java.lang.String filename)
Loads a deep-syntactic structure (DSyntS) defined in a file filename received in parameter formatted XML. Returns a document containing the DSyntS. The document is null if the loading has failed.

validDSyntNode

public boolean validDSyntNode(org.w3c.dom.Element node,
                              boolean recursive)
Verifies whether a DSynt node element is a valid DSynt node or not. The parameter recursive indicates whether or not to verify the validity of the node children. Returns true if the node (and its children) is valid, false otherwise.

validDSyntS

public boolean validDSyntS(org.w3c.dom.Element dsynts)
Verifies whether or not a DSyntS node is valid. Returns true or false.
